tweets.text: It has happened again, @thameswater have notified us they have discharges sewage into the @RiverChess again today, 24th January. It has snowed today but most of it is still on the fields. This is groundwater ingress so an un-permitted discharge. @EnvAgency sharpen your pencil

From this drone pic, you really get a sense of the huge volume of floodwater we‚Äôre dealing with at #Malton, thanks to everyone involved in the major pumping still ongoing to keep everyone safe @EnvAgencyYNE @NorthYorksFire @northyorkscc @RyedaleDC https://t.co/IfK1wLilUU

Today Prime Minister @BorisJohnson visited Didsbury to see how the @EnvAgency and the emergency services are working with local and national government to defend against flooding and support those who might be affected. https://t.co/8U8rHrhdZv

tweets.text: I have data from a survey, interviews and focus groups of almost 300 farmers where 90% indicated they are NOT willing to pay towards advice which is currently free at the point of delivery. Time to get some of that data published I think! @EnvAgency @NFUtweets @FarmersWeekly https://t.co/RopsokkzPV

This illustrates importance of revenue funding scale /certainty re #flooding. Capital settlements like the last ¬£5.2bn may grab headlines but new & upgraded defences without ringfenced long-term maintenance provision potentially undermine progress. https://t.co/eopt6GY4nA

urls.description: New Get Fishing Fund will fund more opportunities for new anglers Environment Agency reports over a million rod licences have been sold this year Higher rod licence sales prompts increased investment in the sport The Environment Agency and Angling Trust have today (1st December 2020) announced a new ¬£100k ‚ÄòGet Fishing Fund‚Äô to encourage more [‚Ä¶]

tweets.text: More transparency and end of pipe fixes won't #EndSewagePollution. This needs a systematic approach beyond @DefraGovUK, @EnvAgency and the water industry. Without strong focus by @mhclg on minimising surface and highway drainage into sewers too it's a sticking plaster not a cure.

Brilliant example by @EnvAgencyYNE of using a tidal defence asset to exclude the tide to make room for incoming fluvial water reducing upstream river flooding.

This clever thinking shows how to make the most out of existing FCRM assets & perhaps better justify new ones. üìèüìêüåä https://t.co/cAbA0wufEc

A regional @EnvAgency manager has drawn fierce criticism after tweeting photos of soil erosion on a farm, saying "20mm of rain [‚Ä¶] caused this. This farmer will be receiving a visit.‚Äù

The soil damage is the result of weeks of heavy rain.
